summary: Citrus Sesame Kale might be just the side dish you are searching for. For 51 cents per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Try Sesame-Citrus Tuna Steaks, Asparagus with Sesame Citrus Sauce, and Sesame Seed Citrus Noodles for similar recipes.
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add ginger and garlic; cook for 30 seconds, or until fragrant, stirring constantly. Add kale and stir until coated with oil. Stir in soy sauce and orange juice; cover and cook for 3 minutes, or until kale is softened.Stir in sesame seeds and red pepper flakes (if using) and serve.

steps.step: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add ginger and garlic; cook for 30 seconds, or until fragrant, stirring constantly.
Add kale and stir until coated with oil. Stir in soy sauce and orange juice; cover and cook for 3 minutes, or until kale is softened.Stir in sesame seeds and red pepper flakes (if using) and serve.

instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Drizzle a little olive oil on a large baking sheet, then use a paper towel to rub the pan down.In a large bowl, add broccoli, olive oil, garlic, and salt to taste. Toss broccoli with a spoon until it's completely coated.Pour broccoli on the prepared baking sheet, spreading out into an even layer. Scoop out any garlic & oil left in the bowl and sprinkle it over the broccoli.Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until broccoli is cooked through.Sprinkle broccoli with parmesan cheese before serving.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.

Drizzle a little olive oil on a large baking sheet, then use a paper towel to rub the pan down.In a large bowl, add broccoli, olive oil, garlic, and salt to taste. Toss broccoli with a spoon until it's completely coated.
Pour broccoli on the prepared baking sheet, spreading out into an even layer. Scoop out any garlic & oil left in the bowl and sprinkle it over the broccoli.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until broccoli is cooked through.
Sprinkle broccoli with parmesan cheese before serving.

title: Avocado Toast with Eggs, Spinach, and Tomatoes
summary: Watching your figure? This dairy free and vegetarian recipe has 274 calories, 13g of protein, and 16g of fat per serving. For $1.57 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 142068 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 10 minutes. Head to the store and pick up salt and pepper, private selection campari tomatoes, shallot, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 100%. This score is spectacular. Similar recipes include Avocado Toast with Smoky Black Beans, Spinach, and Eggs, Baked Eggs in Avocado with Bacon on Toast, and Avocado on toast with chorizo & fried eggs.
instructions: Spray a small skillet with non-stick cooking spray. Add the shallot and spinach and cook over medium heat until spinach is wilted.Place in a small bowl and set aside.Spray the pan again. Pour beaten egg whites or egg into the pan and season with salt and black pepper, to taste. Cook over medium heat until soft-scrambled, about 2 minutes.Mash the avocado with a fork and spread evenly on piece of toast. Top the avocado toast with spinach, scrambled eggs, and tomato slices. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.Note-to make this gluten-free, use gluten-free bread.

steps.step: Spray a small skillet with non-stick cooking spray.
Add the shallot and spinach and cook over medium heat until spinach is wilted.
Place in a small bowl and set aside.Spray the pan again.

Pour beaten egg whites or egg into the pan and season with salt and black pepper, to taste. Cook over medium heat until soft-scrambled, about 2 minutes.Mash the avocado with a fork and spread evenly on piece of toast. Top the avocado toast with spinach, scrambled eggs, and tomato slices. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve immediately.Note-to make this gluten-free, use gluten-free bread.

title: Kale and Quinoa Salad with Black Beans
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Kale and Quinoa Salad with Black Beans a try. One serving contains 242 calories, 10g of protein, and 7g of fat. This gluten free and vegan recipe serves 6 and costs $1.03 per serving. A mixture of salt, vegetable broth, carrot, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. This recipe is liked by 50076 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 50 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 100%. This score is tremendous. Try Skip the Rice and Try Quinoa – Mexican Quinoa Salad with Black Beans and Corn, Black Quinoa & Kale Salad, and Black Quinoa & Kale Salad for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions  Heat a saucepan. Add the rinsed and drained quinoa and the garlic and toast it until almost dry. Add the vegetable broth, bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cover. Simmer until all the water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. While the quinoa is cooking, make the dressing in a small bowl or measuring cup: whisk together the lemon juice, 3 tablespoons broth, chia/flax seeds, chile powders, cumin, and salt. Allow to stand until the chia seeds start to thicken the dressing. Place the kale in a large serving bowl. Add half of the dressing and massage it into the kale using a wringing motion until the kale is very tender. Two minutes of massaging should do it, but the longer, the better. Add the quinoa, black beans, carrot, and bell pepper, along with the remaining dressing. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, check the seasoning and add more lemon juice, chile powder, cumin, and salt, as needed. Stir in chopped avocado, if desired, or serve with slices of avocado on the side.

steps.step: Heat a saucepan.
Add the rinsed and drained quinoa and the garlic and toast it until almost dry.
Add the vegetable broth, bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cover. Simmer until all the water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.

Remove from heat and allow to cool. While the quinoa is cooking, make the dressing in a small bowl or measuring cup: whisk together the lemon juice, 3 tablespoons broth, chia/flax seeds, chile powders, cumin, and salt. Allow to stand until the chia seeds start to thicken the dressing.
Place the kale in a large serving bowl.
Add half of the dressing and massage it into the kale using a wringing motion until the kale is very tender. Two minutes of massaging should do it, but the longer, the better.
Add the quinoa, black beans, carrot, and bell pepper, along with the remaining dressing.

Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, check the seasoning and add more lemon juice, chile powder, cumin, and salt, as needed. Stir in chopped avocado, if desired, or serve with slices of avocado on the side.

winePairing.pairingText: Mexican works really well with Pinot Noir, Sparkling rosé, and Riesling. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The Roserock by Drouhin Oregon Zephirine Pinot Noir with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 58 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Roserock by Drouhin Oregon Zephirine Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: The 2015 Zéphirine convinces you immediately with its dark ruby color and abundant aromatics. Violets, fresh strawberries, cacao, cannelle and a touch of vanilla essence emerge from of the glass. Zéphirine has impressive complexity, defined structure and super length. I trust this wine can be enjoyed for at least 7-10 years, if not more.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

instructions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a medium sized pot. Salt the water and add in your pasta, reduce heat to medium, and cook until Al Dente, about 8-10 minutes.2. While the pasta is cooking, make the sauce by placing the avocado, garlic, lime juice, cilantro, salt and pepper into a food processor or blender. Process until smooth and creamy.3. When pasta is done cooking, drain and place pasta into a large bowl. Add the sauce to the pasta and toss until pasta is well coated. Season with additional salt and pepper, if desired. Serve immediately.Note: This pasta dish is best eaten the day it is made.

steps.step: Bring water to a boil in a medium sized pot. Salt the water and add in your pasta, reduce heat to medium, and cook until Al Dente, about 8-10 minutes.
While the pasta is cooking, make the sauce by placing the avocado, garlic, lime juice, cilantro, salt and pepper into a food processor or blender. Process until smooth and creamy.
When pasta is done cooking, drain and place pasta into a large bowl.
Add the sauce to the pasta and toss until pasta is well coated. Season with additional salt and pepper, if desired.
Serve immediately.Note: This pasta dish is best eaten the day it is made.
